title: Woman’s body pulled from water in Newbury, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News The body was found north of Fordham Way in Newbury, the Essex County District Attorney said.
The body of an unidentified woman was recovered on Thursday in Newbury, after police responded to a call about a body in the water near Harvard Way, the district attorney said.

title: Mass. bakery says it keeps selling out of ‘F— ICE’ cookies, despite death threats
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Food News The cookies have led to threats of assault, rape, and death against the bakery’s employees and their families, but that hasn’t stopped them.
Business is booming like never before at a Western Massachusetts bakery thanks to some politically charged confections.

title: Man convicted of 2022 Caribbean Carnival killing sentenced to nearly 20 years in prison
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The Roslindale man was convicted of several charges, including manslaughter, after he fatally shot a Brighton man in 2022.
A Roslindale man was sentenced Thursday to nearly two decades in prison after he fatally shot a Brighton man during the 2022 Caribbean Carnival in Boston.

Tony Vance, 41, was sentenced in Suffolk Superior Court to 15 to 18 years in state prison for manslaughter, a concurrent sentence of four to five years for possession of a loaded firearm without a license to carry, and two years of probation after he was convicted Wednesday, court records show.

title: Driver dead after car crashes into Medway front yard, catches fire
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News The driver was pulled out of the burning car by bystanders, Medway police said.
By Carson Lyle January 15, 2026 Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A man was killed in Medway Thursday morning after his car crashed onto a front yard of a home and caught fire, police said.

title: Cape Cod man sentenced for threatening federal official and their family
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News He was charged with one count of transmitting interstate threats to injure another person in April 2025.

By Carson Lyle January 15, 2026 | 6:34 PM 1 minute to read A South Dennis man was sentenced on Wednesday after threatening to murder a federal official and their family in March 2025, federal prosecutors said.
